verses.plain: Behold my servant, whom I uphold; mine elect, in whom my soul delighteth; I have put my spirit upon him: he shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.

tokens.t: Behold my servant, whom I uphold; mine elect,
my soul delighteth; I have put my spirit upon him: he shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.

verses.plain: He shall not cry, nor lift up, nor cause his voice to be heard in the street.

tokens.t: He shall not cry, nor lift up, nor cause his voice to be heard in the street.

verses.plain: A bruised reed shall he not break, and the smoking flax shall he not quench: he shall bring forth judgment unto truth.

tokens.t: A bruised reed shall he not break, and the smoking flax shall he not quench: he shall bring forth judgment unto truth.

verses.plain: He shall not fail nor be discouraged, till he have set judgment in the earth: and the isles shall wait for his law.

tokens.t: He shall not fail nor be discouraged, till he have set judgment in the earth: and the isles shall wait for his law.

verses.plain: ¶ Thus saith God the LORD, he that created the heavens, and stretched them out; he that spread forth the earth, and that which cometh out of it; he that giveth breath unto the people upon it, and spirit to them that walk therein:

tokens.t: ¶ Thus saith God the

, he that created the heavens, and stretched them out; he that spread forth the earth, and that which cometh out of it; he that giveth breath unto the people upon it, and spirit to them that walk therein:

verses.plain: I the LORD have called thee in righteousness, and will hold thine hand, and will keep thee, and give thee for a covenant of the people, for a light of the Gentiles;

tokens.t: I the
have called thee in righteousness, and will hold thine hand, and will keep thee, and give thee for a covenant of the people, for a light of the Gentiles;

verses.plain: To open the blind eyes, to bring out the prisoners from the prison, and them that sit in darkness out of the prison house.

tokens.t: To open the blind eyes, to bring out the prisoners from the prison,
them that sit in darkness out of the prison house.

verses.plain: I am the LORD: that is my name: and my glory will I not give to another, neither my praise to graven images.

tokens.t: I
the
: that
my name: and my glory will I not give to another, neither my praise to graven images.

verses.plain: Behold, the former things are come to pass, and new things do I declare: before they spring forth I tell you of them.

tokens.t: Behold, the former things are come to pass, and new things do I declare: before they spring forth I tell you of them.

verses.plain: Sing unto the LORD a new song, and his praise from the end of the earth, ye that go down to the sea, and all that is therein; the isles, and the inhabitants thereof.

tokens.t: Sing unto the
a new song,
his praise from the end of the earth, ye that go down to the sea, and all that is therein; the isles, and the inhabitants thereof.

verses.plain: Let the wilderness and the cities thereof lift up their voice, the villages that Kedar doth inhabit: let the inhabitants of the rock sing, let them shout from the top of the mountains.

tokens.t: Let the wilderness and the cities thereof lift up
, the villages
Kedar doth inhabit: let the inhabitants of the rock sing, let them shout from the top of the mountains.

verses.plain: Let them give glory unto the LORD, and declare his praise in the islands.

tokens.t: Let them give glory unto the
, and declare his praise in the islands.

verses.plain: The LORD shall go forth as a mighty man, he shall stir up jealousy like a man of war: he shall cry, yea, roar; he shall prevail against his enemies.

tokens.t: The
shall go forth as a mighty man, he shall stir up jealousy like a man of war: he shall cry, yea, roar; he shall prevail against his enemies.

verses.plain: I have long time holden my peace; I have been still, and refrained myself: now will I cry like a travailing woman; I will destroy and devour at once.

tokens.t: I have long time holden my peace; I have been still,
refrained myself:
will I cry like a travailing woman; I will destroy and devour at once.

verses.plain: I will make waste mountains and hills, and dry up all their herbs; and I will make the rivers islands, and I will dry up the pools.

tokens.t: I will make waste mountains and hills, and dry up all their herbs; and I will make the rivers islands, and I will dry up the pools.

verses.plain: And I will bring the blind by a way that they knew not; I will lead them in paths that they have not known: I will make darkness light before them, and crooked things straight. These things will I do unto them, and not forsake them.

tokens.t: And I will bring the blind by a way
they knew not; I will lead them in paths
they have not known: I will make darkness light before them, and crooked things straight. These things will I do unto them, and not forsake them.

verses.plain: ¶ They shall be turned back, they shall be greatly ashamed, that trust in graven images, that say to the molten images, Ye are our gods.

tokens.t: ¶ They shall be turned back, they shall be greatly ashamed, that trust in graven images, that say to the molten images, Ye
our gods.

verses.plain: Hear, ye deaf; and look, ye blind, that ye may see.

tokens.t: Hear, ye deaf; and look, ye blind, that ye may see.

verses.plain: Who is blind, but my servant? or deaf, as my messenger that I sent? who is blind as he that is perfect, and blind as the LORD’s servant?

tokens.t: Who
blind, but my servant? or deaf, as my messenger
I sent? who
blind as
perfect, and blind as the
servant?

verses.plain: Seeing many things, but thou observest not; opening the ears, but he heareth not.

tokens.t: Seeing many things, but thou observest not; opening the ears, but he heareth not.

verses.plain: The LORD is well pleased for his righteousness’ sake; he will magnify the law, and make it honourable.

tokens.t: The
is well pleased for his righteousness’ sake; he will magnify the law, and make
honourable.

verses.plain: But this is a people robbed and spoiled; they are all of them snared in holes, and they are hid in prison houses: they are for a prey, and none delivereth; for a spoil, and none saith, Restore.

tokens.t: But this
a people robbed and spoiled;
all of them snared in holes, and they are hid in prison houses: they are for a prey, and none delivereth; for a spoil, and none saith, Restore.

verses.plain: Who among you will give ear to this? who will hearken and hear for the time to come?

tokens.t: Who among you will give ear to this?
will hearken and hear for the time to come?

verses.plain: Who gave Jacob for a spoil, and Israel to the robbers? did not the LORD, he against whom we have sinned? for they would not walk in his ways, neither were they obedient unto his law.

tokens.t: Who gave Jacob for a spoil, and Israel to the robbers? did not the
, he against whom we have sinned? for they would not walk in his ways, neither were they obedient unto his law.

verses.plain: Therefore he hath poured upon him the fury of his anger, and the strength of battle: and it hath set him on fire round about, yet he knew not; and it burned him, yet he laid it not to heart.

tokens.t: Therefore he hath poured upon him the fury of his anger, and the strength of battle: and it hath set him on fire round about, yet he knew not; and it burned him, yet he laid
not to heart.

footnotes.text: devour: Heb. swallow, or, sup up
they are all…: or, in snaring all the young men of them
for a spoil: Heb. a treading
for…: Heb. for the after time?
